decks.notes: This UW Control deck focuses on using counterspells, removal, and card advantage to control the game until it can establish a dominant board position with planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck also utilizes powerful card draw spells like Dig Through Time and Hieroglyphic Illumination to maintain a full hand of options. With a mix of board wipes, counterspells, and versatile removal options, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while slowly gaining incremental advantages to win the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost and efficient creatures and burn spells. By establishing a board presence early and maintaining pressure with direct damage spells, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they can stabilize. The deck aims to curve out smoothly, utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Runaway Steam-Kin to maximize damage output, while also utilizing spells like Lightning Strike and Searing Blood to clear the way for attacks. The inclusion of cards like Light Up the Stage and Experimental Frenzy provide card advantage and deck manipulation to keep the pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively ramp up mana with cards like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves in order to play powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis and Nissa, Who Shakes the World early in the game. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns to control the board and generate advantage. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and planeswalkers while maintaining a strong board presence. Additionally, cards like Walking Ballista and Wicked Wolf provide additional removal options and flexibility in combat situations.

Control the game by using Counterspells, Removal, Card Draw, and powerful Planeswalkers to outvalue and outlast opponents. Utilize cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils to control the board and prevent opponent's game plan. Use removal spells like Supreme Verdict and Blessed Alliance to deal with threats efficiently. Dig Through Time helps find answers when needed, while cards like Jace, Architect of Thought provide card advantage. With a mix of Counterspells, Removal, and Planeswalkers, this deck aims to control the game and secure victory through value and card advantage.

The key concept of this Simic Aggro deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence using efficient creatures like Steel Leaf Champion and Lovestruck Beast, supported by ramp cards such as Elvish Mystic and Gilded Goose. The deck aims to pressure the opponent with early aggression while using disruptive cards like Stubborn Denial to protect its threats. With a mix of powerful planeswalker in Oko, Thief of Crowns and resilient threats like Wicked Wolf, the deck looks to close out the game quickly with efficient beatdowns and combat tricks.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with creatures like Elvish Mystic, Llanowar Elves, and Gilded Goose to play powerful threats such as Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Hydroid Krasis. It also includes disruptive elements like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Wicked Wolf to control the board and pressure the opponent. The deck's strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and generate advantage through mana acceleration and card draw, aiming to finish the game quickly with big threats like Hydroid Krasis and Walking Ballista.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly with mana dorks like Llanowar Elves and Gilded Goose, then play powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Wicked Wolf to control the board. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast mana generation and strong creatures, while also having some versatility with cards like Walking Ballista and Scavenging Ooze for added utility and resilience.

This aggressive deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with elves and generating token creatures to build a board presence. The key strategy is to use cards like Collected Company and Chord of Calling to find key creatures like Shaman of the Pack and Steel Leaf Champion, while utilizing cards like Marwyn, the Nurturer and Elvish Clancaller to increase mana production and power up the team. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of elves and drain their life points with Shaman of the Pack for a quick victory.

The main idea of this Abzan Aggro deck is to quickly establish an aggressive board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy with removal and hand disruption spells. The deck aims to efficiently use its mana base to cast powerful creatures such as Siege Rhino and Emrakul, the Promised End, while also generating card advantage with cards like Grim Flayer and Tireless Tracker. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Liliana, the Last Hope and Vraska, Golgari Queen provides additional utility and threats to further pressure the opponent. Overall, the deck combines aggression, disruption, and card advantage to overwhelm the opponent.

The main objective of this UW Control deck is to maintain control of the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. The deck focuses on controlling the board with cards like Supreme Verdict and Cast Out, while also generating card advantage with cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Dig Through Time. Using Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt opponents' strategies, the deck aims to stall the game until it can deploy powerful finishers like Elspeth, Sun's Champion or Sphinx's Revelation to seal the victory.

The main focus of this deck is to play aggressive creatures early on to quickly overwhelm the opponent while also utilizing countermagic to protect key threats. By efficiently ramping into powerful threats like Steel Leaf Champion and Lovestruck Beast, this deck aims to pressure the opponent and close out the game before they can establish their own game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of disruptive cards like Stubborn Denial and Brazen Borrower adds another layer of versatility and control to keep the opponent off balance. The synergy between creature threats and disruptive spells creates a powerful and cohesive strategy for competitive play.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on utilizing Possibility Storm to disrupt your opponent's game plan and generate unexpected advantages. The deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with a combination of efficient creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Bonecrusher Giant, while also utilizing powerful Planeswalkers like Chandra and Kiora to generate card advantage and additional threats. The inclusion of Enter the Infinite and Borborygmos Enraged provides additional finishers and alternate win conditions to close out games quickly. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure early and disrupt your opponent's strategy to secure victory.

This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. By combining creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion, Scrapheap Scrounger, and Rankle, Master of Pranks with removal spells like Fatal Push and Grasp of Darkness, the deck aims to control the board and deal consistent damage. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain pressure throughout the game.

This UW Control deck focuses on shutting down opponents' strategies through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to control the game by denying resources, countering key spells, and maintaining card advantage with draw spells such as Dig Through Time and Sphinx's Revelation. Cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils help to generate value and slow down opponents. The deck also includes a mix of creature removal, board wipes, and utility lands to deal with a variety of threats and interact with the opponent's side of the battlefield.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful creatures. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan through cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while also maintaining board control with cards like Sylvan Advocate and Scavenging Ooze. The deck also includes cards like Seasons Past and Dark Petition to provide card advantage and access to its key spells. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistency in casting its spells.

This deck focuses on playing efficient threats and disruption spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. It utilizes powerful creatures like Scavenging Ooze and Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet to apply pressure while also running versatile removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay to disrupt the opponent's game plan. In addition, the deck includes powerful control elements like Thoughtseize and Dig Through Time to help maintain card advantage and answer threats. Overall, this deck aims to outvalue and outtempo the opponent to secure a victory.
